byline.contributor: Colin Moynihan and Elizabeth A. Harris contributed reporting.

abstract: New York police commander Deputy Inspector Anthony Bologna, who pepper-sprayed protesters during opening days of Occupy Wall Street demonstrations, faces an internal disciplinary charge that could cost him 10 vacation days.
snippet: Deputy Inspector Anthony Bologna, who could lose 10 vacation days, was found to have run afoul of Police Department rules in a Sept. 24 episode involving protesters in Lower Manhattan.
lead_paragraph: Deputy Inspector Anthony Bologna, who could lose 10 vacation days, was found to have run afoul of Police Department rules in a Sept. 24 episode involving protesters in Lower Manhattan.

headline.main: Commander Who Pepper-Sprayed Protesters Faces Disciplinary Charge
headline.print_headline: Commander Faces Penalty Over Use of Pepper Spray
headline.seo: Commander Who Pepper-Sprayed Wall Street Protesters Faces Disciplinary Charge
